artist: Artist: Utagawa Hiroshige; Publisher: Ibaya Senzaburō
creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
markings: publisher seal: 団扇堂 {Dansendō}; LRC: red collector seal: AM
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From The Journey to the Seven Hot Springs of Hakone (Hakone shichiyu meguri no uchi 箱根七湯巡之内)
text: Located about sixty miles southwest of Tokyo, Hakone has been a popular destination because of its natural hot springs and beautiful mountain scenery. There are seven spas in Hakone, and a number of ukiyo-e artists designed seven-print series featuring them. Depicted here is Ashinoyu hot spring from such a series designed by Hiroshige. The buildings in the foreground are the inns with their hot spring baths that catered to visitors.
title: Ashinoyu
